title: XSS Vuln in Sucuri Security - Auditing, Malware Scanner

summaries.content: A xss vulnerability has been identified that allows an attacker to bypass security scanning process & to redirect some malicious place or simply hijack session cookies .
summaries.content_html: A xss vulnerability has been identified that allows an attacker to bypass security scanning process & to redirect some malicious place or simply hijack session cookies .

activities.message:
Thanks for the report, passed to our team to investigate.

However, step #2 is a bit confusing. How will the person create a file at the root of the site? Or you mean an admin / root can create the file and XSS himself or other admins? Mind giving more details?

thanks,
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for the report, passed to our team to investigate.

However, step #2 is a bit confusing. How will the person create a file at the root of the site? Or you mean an admin / root can create the file and XSS himself or other admins? Mind giving more details?

thanks,

activities.message:
We confirmed the issue and released a patch. The severity is very very low (if any), since it requires someone to have admin access to the site in order to create the exploit.

Let me know if we missed anything.
activities.markdown_message:
We confirmed the issue and released a patch. The severity is very very low (if any), since it requires someone to have admin access to the site in order to create the exploit.

Let me know if we missed anything.

activities.message: Seems fixed , but this is not as much as low severity you might think because it is a scanner plugin & has a huge impact for even self-xss , by the use of that plugin , one can continuously hijack cookies [in background] , bypass / redirect plugin admin page and so more malicious things . Thanks for a sweet & quick fix .
activities.markdown_message: Seems fixed , but this is not as much as low severity you might think because it is a scanner plugin & has a huge impact for even self-xss , by the use of that plugin , one can continuously hijack cookies [in background] , bypass / redirect plugin admin page and so more malicious things . Thanks for a sweet & quick fix .

activities.message:
Care to expand on the impact? It seems to only be affected by files on the root directory of the site. Which only an admin can add/modify. Any one with that level of access can do a lot more than self-XSS, including hack the site, modify wp-config, access the database, modify plugins and do a lot more...

In theory, we would classify it as a non-severity, since admins have unfiltered HTML access already and can add JS code in any post or page on WP.

Let me know.

thanks!

Let me know.

thanks!

activities.message:
Interesting thing is , suppose , i got shell access to a WP site & as an attacker I  can create crafty file name for  redirect admin  from scanner to something null or stop scanning process . I also believe , the points you explained were correct .

Let me know about bounty notifications .
activities.markdown_message:
Interesting thing is , suppose , i got shell access to a WP site & as an attacker I can create crafty file name for redirect admin from scanner to something null or stop scanning process . I also believe , the points you explained were correct .

Let me know about bounty notifications .

activities.message:
Oh yes, if you got shell access to WP, you can just go and edit a file inside wp-admin or even create a user directly in the DB for you by looking at wp-config :) Or even inject the code directly in the DB.

That's why I say very low severity, because it already requires admin access to create an exploit.

In any event, I am marking it as fixed. Always happy to get reports that makes us better. Thanks for sharing!
activities.markdown_message:
Oh yes, if you got shell access to WP, you can just go and edit a file inside wp-admin or even create a user directly in the DB for you by looking at wp-config :) Or even inject the code directly in the DB.

That's why I say very low severity, because it already requires admin access to create an exploit.

In any event, I am marking it as fixed. Always happy to get reports that makes us better. Thanks for sharing!

activities.message: Thanks again , Would you mind disclosing it to public ?
activities.markdown_message: Thanks again , Would you mind disclosing it to public ?

vulnerability_information_html:
Hi ,

As we know , XSS is a security breach that takes advantage of dynamically generated Web pages. In an XSS attack, a Web application is sent with a script that activates when it is read by an unsuspecting user s browser or by an application that has not protected itself against cross-site scripting.

Affected plugin - Sucuri Security - Auditing, Malware Scanner ( https://wordpress.org/plugins/sucuri-scanner/ )

A xss vulnerability has been identified that allows an attacker to bypass security scanning process & to redirect some malicious place or simply hijack session cookies .

Proof of concept :--
[1] Install Sucuri Security - Auditing, Malware Scanner in your WP site
[2] Make a file <img src=xx onerror=prompt(document.cookie)>.png in root directory of your WordPress site
[3] Now , go to xyz.tld/wp-admin/admin.php?page=sucuriscan
[4] Multiple XSS will be triggered with cookie information prompt will be shown , confirming the existence of XSS via file name manipulation .

Impact :-
[1] Redirect to some malicious place
[2] Simply hijack session cookies .
[3] Bypass scanning process

XSS where it is reflected :-

[1] <tr class=" sucuriscan-hidden">
<td class="check-column">
<input type="checkbox" name="sucuriscan_integrity_files[]" value="'""><img src=xx onerror=prompt(0)>.png" />

[2] <span class="sucuriscan-monospace sucuriscan-wraptext">'""><img src=xx onerror=prompt(0)>.png</span>

All screenshots attached .
